column4: Hi guys. im running Ubuntu 11.04 on a white macbook 13", it seems it has crashed trying to run tuxracer.. I can't alt+tab.. or alt+ctrl+del, is there any other way to recover from this kind of crash without pulling the battery?
can you hit ctrl-alt-f1 and get to a tty?
no response.. the machine is responding to pigs however
pigs?
macbook doesn't have a print screen button
you probably need to just hold the power button for about 10 seconds then
indeed.
delete key acts as backspace though
at least mine does
;) just tried it as you said it
yes the other useful one is fn+enter = insert so shift+fn+enter lets you paste what you last selected (like middle click)
nice! thanks for the heads up :)
hmm, shift fn enter doesn't let me paste :O well not in the terminal anyway
you highlighted something with your mouse first?
iv got something on my clipboard, cause i can paste it manually

there are two clipboards in linux.  One is the one your probably used to (ctrl-c to copy, ctrl-v to paste) and the other is the 100 times easier to use one (just highlight what you want to copy, and middle click to paste (or shift-insert))
yep, trying that in the terminal, doesn't work for me
I don't know; if you are in X, it should work
all good, seems i can emulate a middle click on the trackpad by doing a 3 finger tap
another weird thing, when im in an app, say - chromium and i hold in alt.. i can see the File, Edit, View.... come up.. but i cant hold in alt and press F to bring the file menu up?
I don't know
